navigation.title: Home
navigation.body:
U+ DogDemo

This app uses three API calls

  1. App (data.json)

    I put the navigation and other text in a .json file. This way, I can make text changes and add new nav items without editing .js files. For example, I can add a navigation item to this .json file and I do not need to touch the Toolbar and SideDrawer files.
    This file is loaded at root level (App.js) and the class/functional based component props are populated there

  2. Dogs (breeds/list)

    This list is retrieved and sent through <AlphabetList> component using 'react-alphabet-list' package. I have customised this component heavily because the original CSS fails when we put it into responsive views.

  3. Dog (breed/pug/images)

    A simple array of image URLs. On this app, I am using the first 4 of these images, and putting them in a responsive CSS grid layout.

plugins.title: node-sass + sass-loader
plugins.body: All CSS is generated via individual component-related SASS files, imported into App.scss.

plugins.title: axios
plugins.body: Axios is used to handle the API on item details page (in this example, the page showing your chosen dog images).

plugins.title: html-react-parser
plugins.body: I am using a parser so that I can send HTML formatted text as props.

plugins.title: react-slugify
plugins.body: Used to ensure dynamic generated URLs are sanitized.

plugins.title: react-loading
plugins.body: Loading graphic using SVG for reduced filesize. See details (dog photos) page to see loader in action.

plugins.title: react-alphabet-list
plugins.body: This is the A-Z list seen on 'Dogs' page. I have customised this component heavily because the original CSS fails when we put it into responsive views.
